source_caption_data.pre_caption: This is a dramatic time-lapse video of a storm moving over the Grand Canyon. Heavy, dark clouds churn and roll rapidly across the sky. Sheets of rain can be seen falling in the distance, sweeping across the vast canyon landscape.
source_caption_data.pre_caption_prompt: The video is a scenery shot. You do not need to describe the subject motion. Just note that briefly in one to three sentences.
source_caption_data.final_caption: This is a dramatic time-lapse video of a storm moving over the Grand Canyon. Heavy, dark clouds churn and roll rapidly across the sky. Sheets of rain can be seen falling in the distance, sweeping across the vast canyon landscape.

generated_critique: The caption begins with an introductory sentence, "This is a dramatic time-lapse video of a storm moving over the Grand Canyon," which should be removed as it is not a description of motion. The instruction is to avoid emotional or subjective adjectives, so "dramatic" and "vast" should be deleted. The description of the motion itself is accurate but can be made more concise. The two sentences describing the motion can be combined to create a single, direct statement.
revised_caption_by_generated_critique: Heavy, dark clouds churn and roll rapidly across the sky as sheets of rain sweep across the Grand Canyon.
